summary:
Reinier researches impact at Impact Institute. He leads the development of new impact methodology - and making these open source where possible. He has published 10+ publications on the why, what and how of impact measurement. Reinier is particularly proud to have published a review article on True Cost Accounting in Nature Food. 
Previously he was Research Associate at Roland Berger Strategy Consultants, the only leading Management Consultant with European roots. Here, he focused on the energy and transportation sectors. 
Reinier holds a PhD in Theoretical Particle Physics from Leiden University. For his research he regularly traveled to CERN and the University of Padova. In a previous life, Reinier was a world champion in debating (category English as a Second Language) and a silver medalist at the International Biology Olympiad.

awards.title: ISAR Honours Award
awards.description: ISAR (the UNCTAD working group on  International Standards for Accounting and Reporting acknowledged our Framework for Impact Statements as one of the leading initiatives for improvement of reporting by companies on sustainability and the Sustainable Development Goals. Co-winners include the German Council for Sustainable Development and the World Business Council for Sustainable Development.

awards.title: Winner World University Debating Championship in the category English-as-a-second-language
awards.description:
Won the English-as-a-second-language (ESL) category at the World University Debating Championship (WUDC) hosted by Assumption University in Thailand.
At the WUDC 400+ teams of two debaters compete in 9 prelimary and 4 final rounds on various political, economical and philosophical issues. My debating partner Anne Valkering and I won the ESL-final from a German and two Malaysian teams.

awards.title: Pieter Zeeman Prize
awards.description: The Pieter Zeeman Prize is awarded every two years for the best MSc thesis at the physics department of the University of Amsterdam. The prize contains a small sum of money set aside from the Nobel Prize of Pieter Zeeman of 1902.
awards.issuer: Family of Nobel Prize winner Pieter Zeeman

awards.title: Silver Medalist
awards.description: The International Biology Olympiad is the premier high school biology student competition worldwide. It aims to identify, inspire, empower and support the next generation of leaders in the life sciences and to develop their international network.

profile_positions.description:
The mission of Impact Institute is to empower organizations and professionals to realize the 'impact economy'- an economy that has sustainability at its roots and aims at value creation for all rightsholders including wider society, employees and clients.

In the Research Team, I work at the development of impact methodology. Our Framework for Impact Statements was rewarded the UNCTAD ISAR award in 2019. I am also the lead author of the Impact Weighted Accounts Framework that we developed together with i.a. Harvard Business School and Singapore Management University.

In addition, I support the consulting teams in bringing cutting-edge impact information to our clients. I am proud that companies such as ABN AMRO and Alliander have substantial impact paragraphs in their annual reports.
profile_positions.title: Impact Researcher

profile_positions.description:
After the spin-off of Impact Institute by True Price, I remained involved with the mission of True Price: to make clear that all the products we buy and consume leave their traces behind. If I buy my daily cup of tea, a sweater of a new smartphone I don't pay the full price. Environmental and social costs are borne by society.  Making those costs explicit - and allowing consumers to voluntarily contribute to remediation - is a promising path towards a more sustainable economy.

I contributed to all major external publications on true pricing, including its Principles and the underlying Valuation Framework.
profile_positions.title: True Pricer

profile_positions.description:
With all the stuff you buy you leave traces behind. Your morning coffee, daily T-Shirt, or evening lipstick.
Often, natural and social costs are involved. For example: extremely low wages or unsafe work environment for workers; air pollution, or water waste for nature. This damage has a price for people and nature, which isn’t included in the prices you pay at the store.
At True Price we are working on our mission of making it possible for you to see and voluntarily pay the true price of your own products. True Price also guides and trains companies towards implementing the true price practice.

As a Manager and Researcher, I supported companies in assessing the true price of their products - and working toward reducing the social and environmental externalities. One of my favorite projects was for the Dutch chocolate producers Tony's Chocolonely, where we calculated the impact of their strategy to produce the world first 100% slave-free chocolate. In addition, I worked on several publications, such as the Roadmap for True Pricing and reports on the true prices of Jeans, Diamonds and several agri-commodities.
profile_positions.title: Manager and Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Roland Berger Strategy Consultants is a leading international strategy advisory firm with 50 offices around the world.

As a Research Associate, I combined external consultancy projects with internal knowledge development. I mainly focused on the the transportation, energy and manufacturing sectors

My projects include
- Strategy for the development of the bio-based economy in the north-east of the Netherlands. Our clients were the universities of Twente and Groningen,
- Thought piece about the state of the Dutch industry and the improvement potential from application of information technology ('Industry 4.0'​),
- Development of a 'Mobility strategy' for a leading automotive company in the Netherlands. We assessed how they can take advantage of automotive trends such as car sharing
- Development of long-term rail vision for the Dutch Ministry of Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment.
- Organizational redesign for one of the largest infrastructure projects in Europe

volunteer_experiences.description: The IMC Weekendschool teaches helps children in some of the more challenged neighbourhoods of the Netherlands. Professionals from all types of work serve as role models and share their passion with the children. I am a regular guest teacher in Mathematics. But is not the plain math lesson! We play set, learn about contruction and build enourmous 3D figures, such as the truncated icosahedron (better known as a football). I also volunteered in lessons on science experiments, programming, music and architecture.
